www.lawcommission.gov.np  
1 
 Language Commission Act, 2074 (2017)  
Date of Authentication and Publication:                                            
October 16, 2017 ( 2074.06.30 )  
Act No. 40 of the year 2017 (2074)  
An Act made to make arrangements relating to Language Commission  
 
Preamble:   Whereas, it is e xpedient to make legal arrangement  with regard to the 
functions, duties, powers and procedures  of the Language Commission,  
Now, therefore, be it enacted by the Federal Parliament pursuant to 
Article 296 sub -article (1) of the Co nstitution of Nepal.  
 
Chapter -1 
Preliminary  
1. Short Title and Commencement : (1) This Act may be called 
"Language Commission Act, 2017 (2074)."  
  (2)  This act shall come into force immediately.  
2. Definitions : Unless the subject or the context otherwise requires, in this 
Act, -  
(a)  "Chairperson" means the Chairperson of the Commission.  
(b)  "Commission" means the Language Commission 
 established  under Article 2 87 of the Constitution.

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
2 
 (c)  "Prescribed" or "As prescribed " means laws prescribed or 
 as prescribed under the Rules framed under this Act.  
(d)  "Member" means the member of the Commission and the 
 word also includes the Chairperson.  
(e)  "Constitution" means the Constitution of Nepal.  
 
Chapter -2 
Power, Functions,  Duties and Procedures of the Commission  
 
3. Power, Functions  and Duties of the Commission : The power, 
function and duties of the Commission in addition to the power, 
function and duties of the Com mission prescribed in  sub-article (6)  of 
Article 287 of the C onstitution shall be as follows: -  
(a)  to identify the  mother tongue languages spoken in 
 Nepal,  
(b)  to make recommendations to the Government of Nepal 
 regarding the policy or institutional measures to be 
 adopted by the Government of Nepal, State Government or 
 Local Level Government for the protection, promotion and 
 development of the mother tongue languages spoken 
 in Nepal,  
(c)  to formulate necessary programs for the protection, 
 promotion and development  of the mothertongue 
 languages  spoken in Nepal and  their  script , and to make 
 recommendations to the concerned agencies to implement 
 them  or cause them  to be implemented,

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
3 
 (d)  to conduct study  and research on the languages of the 
 mother tongue spoken in Nepal and their history and to 
 publish them,  
(e)  to publish books and to make  recommendations to the 
 concerned agencies for the publication of books for the 
 protection, promotion and development of the languages 
 of the mother tongu e and scripts of various communities,  
(f)  to conduct study and research to make languages of the 
 mother tongue spoken in Nepal technology friendly and to 
 make recommendations to the concerned agencies for the 
 adoption of appropriate measures,  
(g)  to make list s of language experts of National language.  
4. May obtain opinion and consultations : The Commission may receive 
opinions and seek consultations from any constitutional organ, 
government office or public entity,  with relation to  its functions and 
duties.  
5. May obtain service of experts : The Commission may receive services 
from experts, pursuant to the federal law by stating the reasons thereof, 
if the human resource employed within the Commission is unable to  
perform any work that the Commission is required to p erform as per 
this Act and prevailing federal law.  
6. May form  committee or working group : (1) The Commission may 
form a committee or working group with the purpose of perform ing 
specific tasks  relating to the Commission,  by formulating a procedure.

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
4 
 (2) The terms or scope of operation of the committee or working 
group formed pursuant to sub -section (1), shall be as prescribed by the 
Commission at the time of its formation.  
7.  Coordination and Cooperation : The Commission may on the basis 
of necessity, coordin ate and cooperate with government agencies or 
public entities.   
 
Chapter -3 
Power, Func tion, Duties, Remuneration and Facilities of the 
Chairperson and Members  
8.  Power, Function and Duties of the Chairperson : (1) The Chairperson 
 shall  be the chief official of the Commission. Every act, act ion of the 
 Commission shall be conducted on the basis of the general direction 
 and supervision of the Chairperson.  
  (2) In addition to the power, function and duti es contained 
 elsewhere in this Act, the Chairpe rson shall have the following power, 
 function and duties: - 
(a)  to coordinate the work of the Commission,  
(b)  to maintain a leadership role in the work that 
 the Commission has to perform,  
(c)  to supervise and maintain general caretaking 
 of the financial administration, human 
 resource management and management of the 
 office of the Commission,

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
5 
 (d)  to perform  or cause to perform  other 
 activities as prescribed.  
9. Remuneration and Facilities : (1) The remuneration  and other facilities of 
 the Chairperson and Members shall be as provided for  by the Government  
 of Nepal.  
  (2) The remuneration and other facilities fixed pursuant to sub -
 section (1) shall not , so long as the Chairperson and member hold office, 
 be altered to their disadvantag e. 
  (3) A  person who is a recipient of the pension of  the Government of 
 Nepal  appointed as the Chairperson or Member, shall receive only one, 
 either the pension or the remuneration  to be received  for the current post, 
 so long as they hold the office .  
 
Chapter - 4 
Operation of the Commission  
10. Office of the Commission : The office of the Commission shall be 
 established in the Kathmandu Valley for the operation of work of the 
 Commission.  
11. Meeting of the Commission : (1) The meeting of the Commission shall 
decide the activities to be performed by the Commission, in accordance  
with this Act.  
 (2) The meeting of the Commission shall be held on such a date, time 
and venue as prescribed by the Chairperson, based on necessity.

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
6 
   (3) The Secretary of the Commission shall  finalize and notify all 
members of the date, time and venue of the meeting along with a list of the 
agenda to be discussed in the meeti ng, at least 48 hours prior to the meeting .  
 (4) Any member interested to discuss addi tional issues, not included 
within the list of agenda set to be discussed within the meeting pursuant to 
sub-section (3), shall notify the Secretary of the additional issue s and reason 
for their  introduction to the mee ting 24 hours prior to the meeting. Up on 
receipt of such information, the Secretary of the Commission shall notify 
all members and such issue s shall be considered to have been included in 
the list.  
 (5) Notwithstanding anything stated in sub -sections (3) and (4), an 
issue not included within the list may be introduced and decided by the 
Commission, with the agreement of all members present in the meeting.  
 (6) The quorum of the meeting shall be deemed to have been fulfilled 
with the presence of more than 50 percent of the immediate members of  the 
Commission.  
 (7) The meeting of the Commission shall be chaired by the 
Chairperson of the Commission.  
 (8) The decision of the majority shall be the decision of the 
Commission and in case of a tie, the Chairperson shall give a decisive vote.  
 (9) Th e Secretary of the Commission shall create a depository of the 
decision of the Commission, authenticating  it with the signatures of the 
Chairperson and Members.

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
7 
   (10) The seniormost official of the Commission shall act as the 
Secretary of the Commission  in the meeting of the Commission . 
  (11) Other procedures related to the meeting of the Commission shall 
 be as  determined by the Commission . 
12. Not to take part in the decision making in case of conflict of interest :  
If any member of the Commission has  any interest, concern or benefit  
arising from any issue under consideration in the Commission or if the near 
relatives of such persons stand to benefit directly or indirectly, such 
member should give prior information to the Commission regarding such 
matters and the member shall not take part in the decision making process 
concerning such matter in the Commission.  
13.  Work Division : The division of the work of the Chairperson and Member 
shall be as determined by the Commission.  
14.  Work to be performed as an acting : The senior most Member of the 
Commission, shall work as the acting Chairperson,  if the position of the 
Chairperson falls vacant due to any reason,  is suspended , has gone for a 
foreign visit or is on leave for more than 7 days.   
15.  Work, pe rformance of the Commission not to be interrupted : The 
vacancy of posts of the Chairperson and/or any Member shall not interrupt 
the works of the Commission.

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
8 
 Chapter -5 
Miscellaneous  
 
16.  Organizational Structure and Employees of the Commission : (1) The 
organizational structure and appointment of employees of the Commission 
shall be as approved by the Government of Nepal.  
 (2) The Government of Nepal shall make available the employees 
necessary for the Commission to perform its work.  
17. Oath : The me mbers appointed after this Act comes into force, shall take 
 an oath before the Chief Justice as set  forth in the Schedule.   
18.  Conduct of Post  to be adhered : The conduct of the post to be adhered by 
the Chairperson and Members of the Commission shall be  as follows:  
(a)  to perform the responsibilities  of the post, 
 independently, impartially and honestly,  
(b)  not to commit any act that would create discord in the 
 relationship between different ethnicities, communities 
 and identities.  
19.  Cooperation  to be extended : It shall be the duty of any agency or official 
with which the Commission seeks assistance, to cooperate with the 
Commission in course of the performance of its functions.   
20. Power to write for assistance : If the Commission finds that an y agency or 
official has not made available assistance necessary to the Commission, it

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
9 
 may write to the higher agency or official above such agency or official for 
assistance in the matter.  
21. Annual report : (1) The Commission shall submit an annual report of the 
 work  and activities performed by the Commission, to the pr esident within 
 three months of the date of expiry of the fiscal year.  
 (2) The report made pursuant to sub -section (1) shall inter -alia, 
include the following matters, in addition to other details: - 
(a) Details of implementation of annual programs of the 
 Commission and expenses incurred,  
(b)  Details of suggestions, recommendations given by 
 the Commission to Nepal Government or any other 
 agency,  
(c)  The status of the implementation of the suggestions, 
 recommendations given in accordance to clause (b),  
(d)  Situation of physical and economic resources of the 
 Commission and their utilization,  
(e)  Details of other activities performed by the 
 Commission  in course of fulfilling the 
 responsibilities required to be performed by it, in 
 accordance to this Act.  
22.  Liaison with Government of Nepal : The Ministry of Culture, Tourism 
 and Civil  Aviation  shall liaise the Commission with the Government of 
 Nepal.

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
10 
 23.  Delegation of Power : The Commission may delegate some a uthority 
 accorded to it by this Act, as per necessity, with set conditions for its use 
 and adherence, to the Chairperson, Member, Government of Nepal, Stat e 
 Government, official employee of an y agency or Local Government.  
24. Power to frame rules : (1) The Commission may  frame necessary rules for 
 the implementation of this Act.  
  (2) The Commission shall have to get the approval of the 
 Government of Nepal, Ministry of Finance, while making r ules pursuant to 
 subsection (1), on  matters that impose financial burden or liability on the 
 Government of Nepal.  
  (3) The rules made pursuant to sub -section (1) shall come into 
 force, from the date of publication in the Nepal Gazette.  
25.  Power to frame Directives : The Commission may, subject to this Act or 
 rules framed under this Act, issue directives to conduct or cause to conduct 
 the smooth operation of its work.

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
11 
 Schedule  
(Related to Section 17)  
Oath  
I ............ (name of the oath taker) ...........  hear-by swear  to remain fully  loyal to 
the country and people. Take an oath in the name of the God/Country and people 
that I shall remain loyal to the Constitution of Nepal that vests ruling power of 
Nepal and sovereignty in the Nepali people, being in the post of ...............  shall 
discharge the duties assigned to me in accordance to the  the laws in force, for the 
best interest of the nation and people, without fear, partiality or favor, malice or 
greed, and that I shall not disclose , in an y manner or sign, except as required for 
the adherence of laws,  any matter  related with the service which is known to me 
in course of fulfillment of my obligations, either directly or indirectly at any time, 
irrespective of whether or not I remain in the s ervice .
